Briles and Hollingshead are among the inventors on these patents and could gain monetarily if a PspA-containing vaccine were licensed for human use. Drs. Briles and Hollingshead provided advice concerning PspA family determination and assisted with manuscript preparation, but all of the data was collected the authors’ group in Japan, which has no conflicts of interest with the data obtained. This does not alter the authors’ adherence to all the PLOS ONE policies on sharing data and materials.
